channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MO

item.title: Report E-2024070045
item.description:
Report E-2024070045

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-05T18:14:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: GRANDVIEW
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed that the released material impacted a concrete terminal floor and estimated that three (3) gallons of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 85-gallon poly drum. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned up the released material and overpacked the damaged drum and generated waste. The generated waste was staged onsite at their terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024061655
item.description:
Report X-2024061655

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-19
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MCIR facility a open fiberboard box was found containing a plastic jug of UN3082. The fiberboard box did not have any DG markings or paperwork required for transport. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and is being held at the location.
